variant.question: Rain is formed within warm clouds when a particle, such as a grain of dust, attracts a drop of moisture to itself. In a next step, this initial cloud droplet will..

options.text: collide with other droplets, thereby growing in size and eventually forming a rain drop.
be taken higher by updrafts in the cloud, thereby freezing and growing in size due to collisions with other ice crystals.
leave the cloud, eventually forming the final rain drop at and below the cloud base, as this is where the humidity is highest.
merge with other droplets, a process which is greatly improved if the colliding drops feature the same electrical charge.

variant.question: Rain is formed within warm clouds when a particle, such as a grain of dust, attracts a drop of moisture to itself. In a next step, this initial cloud droplet will...
